articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: The European Court of Justice (ECJ) this morning ruled that Fifa and Uefa acted illegally in blocking the proposed European Super League (ESL) in 2021.  The ESL was a ham-fisted attempted cash grab by a group of ‘elite’ clubs who despite operating in the world’s most lucrative football cartels, wanted more money. Uefa responded today [...]
articles.title: ECJ ruling will breakup national leagues

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: IT was all over for Leigh Griffiths at Celtic on January 16 2022 when his contract was scrapped and a financial package was thrashed out between the club and player for the remaining five months of his terms. It was an ignominious end to the striker’s career at Parkhead following his £1.2million arrival from Wolves [...]
articles.title: GRIFF: THE GOODBYE

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: LEIGH GRIFFITHS was thrown a career lifeline when Ange Postecoglou, who had been appointed Celtic manager on June 10 2021, triggered the 12-month extension on his contract on July 1. The striker, who was due to turn 31 the following month, looked to be heading for the Parkhead exit after claiming a meagre seven goals [...]
articles.title: GRIFF: THE GRIEF

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: LEIGH GRIFFITHS held aloft the Premiership trophy for the first time after Celtic’s 3-1 victory over Dundee United at a packed Parkhead on Sunday May 11 2014. The frontman’s 39 goals in two loan spells at Hibs had persuaded manager Neil Lennon to pay out £1.2million to parent club Wolves at the turn of the [...]
articles.title: GRIFF: THE GLORY

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: COLOURFUL and controversial, Leigh Griffiths rode an emotional rollercoaster during his eight years at Celtic. The lively little marksman fired in over a century of goals for the Hoops and may have expected a fanfare of trumpets to herald the curtain coming down on his career in the east end of Glasgow. Instead, there was [...]
articles.title: GRIFF: THE GOALS

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: Context is all, and the context for reporting of the ticket ‘dispute’ for our Newco game on the 30th was significantly skewed.  In brief: After humiliating defeats by Celtic at Ibrox, Newco cut Celtic ticket numbers by 90%.  This led to 700 Celtic fans in a corner of the stadium with bottles and other missiles [...]
articles.title: Skewed reporting of ticket ‘dispute’

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: NEIL LENNON made personal and club history as Celtic beat Hearts in the Scottish Cup Final at Hampden on December 20 2020. The all-conquering Hoops claimed their TWELFTH successive domestic honour and the phenomenal quadruple treble when they took the silverware 4-3 on penalty-kicks following a dramatic 3-3 extra-time draw with the Edinburgh outfit. Kristoffer [...]
articles.title: HISTORY BHOY’S LAST HURRAH

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: NEIL LENNON utilised 17 players on the day Celtic claimed a unique place in Scottish football history by sealing the phenomenal quadruple treble. Three years ago today, on December 20 2020, the Hoops claimed their TWELFTH successive domestic trophy when they overcame Hearts 4-3 on penalty-kicks following a dramatic 3-3 extra-time stalemate at a Covid-enforced [...]
articles.title: CELTIC’S QUADRUPLE HEROES: WHERE ARE THEY NOW?

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC achieved glorious history when they overcame Hearts in a dramatic penalty-kick shoot-out to lift their TWELFTH successive domestic honour on a drizzly Sunday afternoon of December 20 2020. The spot-kick victory, with rookie goalkeeper Conor Hazard the unlikely hero with two full-length stops, was sealed as the Hoops triumphed 4-3 following a thrilling 3-3 [...]
articles.title: QUADRUPLE TREBLE (Season 2019/20)

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: While you, me, the manager and captain can agree we need to strengthen in January, the mood in the camp will not be entirely positive until several frustrated players move on.  There is a lot of work to do here, especially in central defence. Nat Phillips is not getting much love these days.  This is [...]
articles.title: Regrets, we have a few

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: PAUL LAMBERT has complete trust in Brendan Rodgers to steer Celtic through troubled waters. The former Hoops skipper isn’t pressing any panic buttons after his old club stumbled to their second consecutive Premiership loss at the weekend. The 2-0 defeat from Hearts at Parkhead followed hot on the heels of the 2-1 nosedive to Kilmarnock [...]
articles.title: CRISIS? WHAT CRISIS? ‘ABSOLUTELY NO WORRIES,’ INSISTS CELTIC GREAT

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: ARGENTINIAN left-back Alexandro Bernabei looks to be heading for a Celtic exit next month. The 24-year-old left-back cost £3.75million when he arrived from top-flight club Lanus 18 months ago, but has failed to make an impact. Bernabei arrived as competition to Greg Taylor in the No.3 position, but first-team appearances have been few and far [...]
articles.title: CELTIC CLEAR-OUT: £3.75m MISFIT HEADS FOR EXIT

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS won his seventh successive domestic honour as Celtic manager before Neil Lennon took over to guide the Hoops to an outstanding treble treble in the eventful season of 2018/19. Even the abrupt and unexpected change of team boss in February could not derail the Parkhead from their relentless pursuit of domestic silverware in [...]
articles.title: TREBLE TREBLE (Season 2018/19)

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: A team that dropped only two points in 13 games has now dropped a further eight across five games.  That’s a significant change in form over the last three weeks.  We beat Aberdeen 6-0 ahead of the last international break, returned to draw 1-1 with Motherwell, were less then impressive in wins over St Johnstone [...]
articles.title: Results watershed points to an obvious problem

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: IT was just VAR-CICAL at Hampden yesterday as once again technical assistant Andrew Dallas baffled fans at the game and millions of worldwide viewers watching the action on the Viaplay satellite channel. The incident that created such puzzlement arrived in the 27th minute of the League Cup Final. It was still goalless when Aberdeen swung [...]
articles.title: NO PENALTY? PULL THE OTHER ONE, Mr DALLAS

articles.description: CAMERON CARTER-VICKERS was involved in a pivotal moment that pushed Celtic towards their first league defeat at Parkhead to end a superb 51-game sequence. The rugged centre-back was penalised by referee Kevin Clancy for a challenge on Nat Atkinson that saw Hearts awarded a direct free-kick in a dangerous area, a decision queried by CQN [...]
articles.title: ‘WE WEREN’T GOOD ENOUGH,’ NO EXCUSES FROM CCV WHO QUERIES REFEREE CALL

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: IT WAS a spectacular case of deja vu for Brendan Rodgers and Celtic as they made history in season 2017/18 – the first Scottish club to achieve the amazing double treble. In another CQN EXCLUSIVE, we turn the spotlight on a second clean sweep of domestic silverware for the Hoops as they once again triumphed [...]
articles.title: DOUBLE TREBLE (Season 2017/18)

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS did not attempt to deflect the blame as the flak flew following Celtic’s second consecutive Premiership defeat. Disgruntled fans let fly at the board after Hearts had won 2-0 to follow up last weekend’s 2-1 loss to Kilmarnock at Rugby Park, two setbacks that saw the champions shed six valuable points. However, Rodgers stood [...]
articles.title: ‘I NEED TO FIND THE ANSWERS,’ RODGERS

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: An aspect of football is so ineffective it is increasingly abandoned as a strategy.  When facing Celtic, however, corner kicks are routinely delivered into the heart of the box, providing a remarkably successful return. If the reason Alistair Johnston was hooked at halftime yesterday was because he lost his man at the opening Hearts goal, [...]
articles.title: Soft Cel

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: KYOGO FURUHASHI extended his worrying goalless sequence to seven games with his shot-shy performance in the dismal 2-0 failure against Hearts at Parkhead yesterday. The Japanese international striker went into the encounter after firing blanks in outings against Motherwell, Lazio, St Johnstone, Hibs, Kilmarnock and Feyenoord, as CQN pointed ou, before another duck egg against the [...]

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC were already trailing to a Lawrence Shankland header when referee Kevin Clancy awarded Hearts a free-kick on the half-hour mark. The match official adjudged Cameron Carter-Vickers had fouled Nat Atkinson about 30 yards from Joe Hart’s goal. The decision baffled thousands of onlookers at Parkhead as well as astonishing the USA World Cup centre-back [...]
articles.title: FOUL? WHAT FOUL, Mr CLANCY?

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: RAGING Brendan Rodgers apologised to the Celtic supporters after the champions’ tame 2-0 surrender to Hearts at Parkhead yesterday. And the Hoops boss also admitted he wasn’t surprised at the lacklustre display that brought the team their second successive Premiership game to blow open the title race. It was a day of massive frustration and [...]

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS replaced Norwegian Ronny Deila in the summer of 2016 to kick off Celtic’s unsurpassable silverware crusade over FOUR years of total domestic domination. The Irishman followed in the footsteps of Jock Stein and Martin O’Neill as a Hoops manager to lead the club to a clean sweep of honours  by lifting the league [...]

articles.author: celtic
articles.description:
THANK YOU Another sold out print edition of the fanzine. If you still want to read the fanzine you can still download the digital edition. Never miss a copy and get it delivered straight through your letterbox as soon as the ink is dry.
The post THANK YOU – Mt90M ISSUE 130 SOLD OUT appeared first on Celtic Fanzine.
articles.title: THANK YOU – Mt90M ISSUE 130 SOLD OUT

articles.author: celtic
articles.description:
* TICKETS ON SALE * Tribute to Shane Saturday 06 Jan We are delighted to announce that Paul Sheridan – Singer, Songwriter of Glasgow Irish Folk Rockers, The Wakes will be joining us to celebrate the life and music of Legendary Pogues front man, Shane MacGowan. Paul will join Ronan McQuillan from the Enemies and […]
The post Tribute to Shane appeared first on Celtic Fanzine.
articles.title: Tribute to Shane
